page.title: 06ECOLOGY CONTINUED.
page.content: WALLS AS IT PASSES THROUGH THE CHETWYND ESTATE. THE MAIN KIND OF BOUNDARY ALONG THE MANY LANES IN THE AREA WAS HEDGING . THE FIRST HEDGEROW WE STUDIED WAS NEAR THE VILLAGE OF FORTON NEXT TO FARMLAND (03750321). WE MEASURED TEN PACES ALONG A SECTION OF HEDGEROW AND NOTED DOWN THE PLANTS AND ANY ANIMAL LIFE. THE HEDGE WAS ON A BANK ABOVE A DITCH. THE MAIN SHRUB OF THE HEDGE WAS HAWTHORN WITH SOME HOLLY, FIELD MAPLE AND HONEYSUCKLE. WE FOUND THE CHICKS OF GUINEA FOWL RUNNING ALONG THE HEDGE AS WELL AS A BLACKBIRDS NEST. ON THE BANK BELOW THE HEDGE WERE BRAMBLES AND COMMON CLEAVERS WHICH WE CALL GOOSE GRASS. THIS PLANT IS COVERED IN LITTLE HAIRS WHICH MAKE IT CLING TO OUR CLOTHES. OTHER PLANTS ON THE BANK WERE GRASSES, NETTLES, HEDGE PARSLEY,WHITE CAMPION, BUTTERCUPS AND SOME DOCK.
